titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Schauffler family papers

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday December 6, 2018 at 08:35

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Correspondence, subject files, printed materials, and photographs documenting the lives of members of the Schauffler family.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Elizabeth Lyman, 1982, 1985, 2000; gift of Peter Schauffler,1985, 2000; gift of Richard Schauffler, 1985.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The original accession is open for research. Accession 2000-M-128 is unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The donors and their heirs retain all copyright and other property rights that they may have in the papers and other materials donated to the Yale University Library until January 1, 2051, following which these rights become the property of Yale University Library. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Schauffler family Papers (MS 1389). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, subject files, printed materials, and photographs documenting the lives of members of the Schauffler family.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The material is unprocessed and may contain sensitive information or be in a physical state that would prohibit use. Researchers wishing to request access should email mssa.assist@yale.edu requesting specific box numbers in order to initiate the review process, which may take several weeks.
